intro: Microseris bigelovii, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, cylindrical stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky habitats. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its seed pods are capsule-like and release seeds when mature. Microseris bigelovii is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
